The suite of applications are developed in a mixed bag of C++ (C++ 11) and C#. Senior Software Consultant Intel Corporation September 2012  –  March 2013  (7 months) Folsom, CA New development and code maintenance for graphics chips test software. The code is C++ legacy code developed by Intel to test graphics chip architecture from software simulation to silicon. Software Consultant SE&I, Boeing, ViArch Inc. Rockwell Collins 2004  –  September 2012  (8 years) Southern California Developed C++, C# and LabVIEW automated measurement solutions and control solutions for laboratory equipment, CNC machines, RF analysis and generation and radar technologies Principal Software Engineer LinQuest Inc April 2006  –  December 2010  (4 years 9 months) Implemented a LabVIEW based tool to allow dynamic configuration, data capture and signal manipulation from a "Rhode and Schwartz FSH18" spectrum analyzer. The tool is used to detect and measure the overlapping of antenna patterns between the Thuraya and Inmarsat satellite constellations. 
Responsible for the design and development phase of modeling and simulation applications used to simulate the exchange of messages between the satellite payload and terminals. The simulation incorporated several terminals (PCs) communicating with each other using messages in accordance to the PTICD requirements and a standalone application acting as a payload resource allocation unit. The payload resource allocation algorithm was developed entirely by me.  
Designed and implemented specialized tools for the Linux platform used to measure the throughput of the satellite payload router. Linux was the choice platform because it satisfied the requirement of nearly 1Gb/sec throughput. 
Designed and implemented a scenario processor tool for Windows. The tool allowed dynamic positioning of military units and terminals on the world map, the display of satellite antenna patterns and mobility path for mobile terminals. Once the scenario was complete, a loading request for the satellite payload could be generated. The loading request was used to test the resource allocation algorithm for the satellite payload. 
Implemented several high performance DLLs in C++ to facilitate fast image drawing and image manipulations for the Scenario Processor mentioned above. LabVIEW Software Consultant Rockwell Collins June 2008  –  March 2009  (10 months) Responsible for the analysis, design and development of a suite of test applications used by Rockwell Collins for the production of sub-assemblies for the new G650 corporate jet from Gulfstream LabVIEW Consultant Rockwell Collins June 2008  –  March 2009  (10 months) Participated in the design phase of a suite of LabVIEW test applications for Rockwell Collins. Responsible for implementing all the PXI based LabVIEW drivers used to collect the signals from various electro-mechanical sub-assemblies.  
Implemented LabVIEW drivers to control multiple stepper motors simultaneously, including edge counters used to control precisely the position of each axis. 
Responsible for the implementation of a multi-axis endurance test application used by Rockwell Collins test engineers to perform the required endurance test for all the sub-assemblies delivered to Gulfstream. The application was written in LabVIEW and can control simultaneously and independently up to 8 stand alone stepper motors, the attached edge counters and various force sensors. The application allows the test engineers to define independent test scripts for each of the axis and run each axis as a separate application within the main application. 
 
Directv 
Responsible for the integration phase of the latest generation of home media center and satellite receiver for Directv.  
Implemented fast drawing routines using assembly language for the specialized Broadcom RISC processor used in the Directv home media center. 
Implemented a Linux driver to display messages while the Linux kernel is booting.  
Worked with various 3rd party vendors to integrate and analyze the performance of Linux drivers, hardware controllers and middleware components for the satellite receiver. DirecTV Software Consultant June 2005  –  April 2006  (11 months) Responsible for the analysis, development and integration of the latest generation of home media center and satellite receiver. Lead Software Engineer DaTARIUS Technologies Inc May 2004  –  April 2006  (2 years) Implemented several DLLs to facilitate communication between LabVIEW based applications and digital cameras. 
Implemented a DLL wrapper to allow LabVIEW based applications to communicate with an industrial IO boxes. 
Researched, designed and implemented a feature finding algorithm used to locate the center of a disc in an image. The algorithm is used for a printing quality control system and for an automated CD identification system. The implementation of the algorithm was done using Intel's IPP libraries and custom assembly routines to boost performance. 
Researched, designed and implemented a barcode position detection algorithm used to identify the CD type and brand for automated quality control analysis. It is the first algorithm in the industry to locate the barcode automatically. This allows an increase in production and reduction of cost for CD robotic handlers. Due to this algorithm, the company won a major contract with a manufacturer of CD handlers and printers. 
Expanded an existing CD/DVD digital analyzer by implementing several new features: new and improved calibration procedure, spot test, etc. 
Helped debug, maintain and expand the company's existing technology core. lead software engineer DaTARIUS Technologies Inc May 2004  –  April 2006  (2 years) Leader of a team of 3 engineers responsible for the design, implementation and integration of specialized image processing algorithms, drivers and hardware control DLLs for automated quality control systems for the CD printing industry. Lead Software Engineer NextEngine Inc January 2000  –  May 2004  (4 years 5 months) Member of a research and development team responsible for developing new technologies for a state of the art 3D scanner. 
Designed and implemented a symmetry detection algorithm based on texture analysis and known features detection within the texture image. To increase performance, some of the heavy processing routines were written in assembly. 
Designed and implemented a texture based alignment algorithm based on common features detection within the texture of 2 adjacent 3D scans - used template matching approach to register common features. To increase performance, some of the heavy processing routines were written in assembly. 
Implemented an abstraction layer around Intel's Performance Libraries using macros and specialized templates - insuring easy transition to other performance libraries when needed. 
Designed and implemented a socket based communication protocol between a controlling server and multiple client PCs servicing multiple 3D scanners each. 
Responsible for the design, implementation and testing of a platform independent graphic library (DLL). 
Responsible for the design, partial implementation and testing of an XML based communication package (DLL), that allows the PC client application to communicate with our specialized servers. 
Responsible for the expanding, debugging and testing of our complex PC application. 
Designed, implemented and tested a proprietary USB based communication package for acquiring 3D and 2D data from the 3D scanner. 
Designed and partially implemented a new, proprietary, algorithm for creating a 3D mesh from a point cloud (worldwide patent currently pending).  
Developed image processing and geometric correction libraries, including the computational geometry algorithms used by the libraries.  
Developed the USB based WDM mini-driver for the 3D scanner. lead software engineer NextEngine Inc January 2000  –  May 2004  (4 years 5 months) Leader of a team of up to 6 engineers responsible for the design, implementation and integration of various libraries, image processing algorithms, drivers, and in-house utilities used for testing, calibration, and developing of new technologies necessary for the company's current projects. Software Engineer Synerdyne Corp January 1997  –  January 2000  (3 years 1 month) Developed a keyboard emulator for a 2D laser scanner which allowed data input through a Palm Pilot touch screen. The simulator consisted of the graphic library used to display the keys on the screen in various fonts, formats and sizes, and the keyboard emulator, which converted screen touches into keyboard codes. 
Designed and implemented a VxWorks driver for a signature capture pad for a wireless POS.  
Implemented the Java driver, including the JNI link between the signature capture pad driver and the JVM. The Java driver was implemented in accordance with the Java POS specifications. 
Implemented a proprietary serial port communication package, which allowed lossless data transfer over infrared serial ports between the VxWorks hand held POS system and Wn98/NT machines (the challenge was to bypass WinNT serial port abstraction layer and to get full control to the serial lines). 
Various utilities to help debugging and testing the POS units. 
Developed a bulk and isochronous USB WDM driver for Win98/2K.

Summary I have enjoyed over thirty years in the computer industry and I am eager to share my knowledge. I have a comprehensive system management, programming, and project management enthusiasm that will energize any workplace. My work includes knowledge of various Manufacturing, Engineering and Scientific Environments. 
 
I have a broad hands-on data center operations management expertise which includes hardware planning, software updates, production scheduling, and analysis of system failure and fault isolation utilizing Root Cause Analysis tools and techniques.  
 
I have a a wide-ranging knowledge of operating environments starting with RSX-11M going to the latest versions of the OpenVMS operating system. This knowledge includes OpenVMS server support and administration on Itanium, Alpha and VAXen platforms utilizing Clusters, TCP/IP Services and Multinet, CA Job Scheduler, and StorageWorks disk technologies including Fibre Channel SAN, MSA/EVA controllers. My systems management experience also includes various UNIX implementations notably Solaris, AIX, Tru64 and HP-UX. I also operate an Itanium/Alpha/VAX Cluster at home and Alpha Emulator on my laptop utilizing the OpenVMS Hobbyist License. 
 
I have a broad experience in writing and maintaining multilingual applications, demonstrating a strong technical background utilizing Calling Standards and System Services and Libraries. My application development experience includes projects utilizing continuous improvement tools and techniques. I endevor to leverage learned and prior work experience in the design and implementation of robust, innovative technological solutions to complex problems. I have lead reviews championing new technology, documenting lessons learned and recommending enhancements or improvements where appropriate.
